thread.title: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami to seek vote of confidence on Saturday
thread.title_full: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami to seek vote of confidence on Saturday

title: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami to seek vote of confidence on Saturday
text: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami to seek vote of confidence on Saturday Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami to seek vote of confidence on Saturday | TNN | Feb 16, 2017, 08.14 PM IST Tamil Nadu chief miister   The newly sworn in Edappadi K Palaniswami ministry in Tamil Nadu will seek a vote of confidence in the assembly at 11am on Saturday. The Palaniswami ministry took oath on Thursday evening. While inviting Palaniswami to form the ministry earlier in the day,   requested him to seek   "Under Section 26 (1), Speaker P Dhanapal has summoned the assembly on February 18 at 11am. On the occasion, motion for vote of confidence of the ministry will be taken up," assembly secretary AMP Jamaludeen said in a brief statement. After taking oath, chief minister Palaniswami went to the memorials of late chief ministers J Jayalalithaa, MGR and Annadurai and offered floral tributes. Later, he went to a resort at Koovathur where more than 100 party MLAs have been staying since February 8 after the then chief minister O Panneerselvam revolted against party general secretary V K Sasikala. Sources said the MLAs would continue to stay at the resort till Saturday before attending the assembly on Saturday. Palaniswami is likely to go to Bengaluru to seek the blessings of Sasikala who has been lodged in the Parappana Agrahara jail since Wednesday after the Supreme Court upheld the trial court's verdict in disproportionate assets case.
